Q_DESC:
LittleBajju isn't too fond of strings. Infact long strings scare him. To scare him, his naughty friend Dwij has given him several long strings. You being Bajju's true friend want to help him by making the strings empty. In order to make any given string empty, you have to do one or more deletion operations on that string. But you cannot do just any deletion operation. You are only allowed to delete the substring "IEM" from any position of the string, any number of times. Can you help Little Bajju by making the strings empty ?

Input
The first line of input is an integer T, denoting the number of strings. T lines follow, each consisting of a string S that comprises of only uppercase letters E, I and M (not necessarily in order).

Output
For each string output 'Yes' if you can convert it into an empty string, else output 'No' on a separate line.

Constraints
1  T  10
1  |s|  100000
